page.title: 08The Highway Flats- York Road
page.content: The Highway Flats are in two blocks. Each block is ten floors high and there are six apartments on each floor. This makes 60 apartments in each block. Each block has two lifts. They are mainly for elderly people. Behind them is good parking spaces and garages. The ground surrounding the flats has been laid with grass and some flower beds have been planted. There are benches there for relaxation. High rise flats are not common in this part of the study area. The Highway Flats and the Deane - Halton are the only two sites for this type of housing. The Deane has three high rise blocks of 10 storiess, each block with 60 apartments. These were built in 1961.
